com.clarkparsia.openrdf
Interface FunctionalGraph

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Collection<Statement>, Graph, java.lang.Iterable<Statement>, java.io.Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ExtGraph
public interface FunctionalGraph
extends Graph

Convenience interface for a Sesame Graph for applying some of the Guava functional objects to a Graph.

Since:
0.8
Version:
0.8
Author:
Michael Grove

Method Detail

filter

Graph filter(Predicate<Statement> thePredicate)
Create a filtered copy of the graph

Parameters:
thePredicate - the predicate to use for filtering
Returns:

transform

Graph transform(Function<Statement,Statement> theFunction)
Transform the contents of the graph. This returns a copy of the original graph with the transformation applied

Parameters:
theFunction - the function for the transform
Returns:
the transformed graph

find

Optional<Statement> find(Predicate<Statement> thePredicate)
Find a Statement which satisfies the given Predicate

Parameters:
thePredicate - the predicate
Returns:
Optionally, the first Statement to satisfy the Predicate, or an absent Optional if none do

any

boolean any(Predicate<Statement> thePredicate)
Return whether or not at least one Statement satisfies the Predicate

Parameters:
thePredicate - the predicate
Returns:
true if at least one Statement satisfies the Predicate, false otherwise

all

boolean all(Predicate<Statement> thePredicate)
Return whether or not all statements satisfy the Predicate

Parameters:
thePredicate - the predicate
Returns:
true if at all Statements satisfy the Predicate, false otherwise

collect

<T> java.util.Collection<T> collect(Function<Statement,Optional<T>> theFunction)
Collect the results of the Function as it is applied to each Statement. Absent values are not collected; the provided function should never return a null value.

Parameters:
theFunction - the function
Returns:
the collected values
